activities.message: I think, it also will be work on rev-qa-app.informatica.com and rev-preview-app.informatica.com
@yarbabin Can you still reproduce this? Doesn't seem to be working correctly.

Its still working. URL decode SAMLResponse parameter, then decode base64. Change evilhost to your host. After this i have request on my host:

`connect to [95.213.191.87] from ec2-54-149-98-204.us-west-2.compute.amazonaws.com [54.149.98.204] 53883`
`GET /xxe HTTP/1.1`
`Cache-Control: no-cache`
`Pragma: no-cache`
`User-Agent: Java/1.8.0_66`
`Host: 95.213.191.87`
`Accept: text/html, image/gif, image/jpeg, *; q=.2, */*; q=.2`
`Connection: keep-alive`
@yarbabin Are you modifying the same request from above? I have modified the evilhost section, but still am not getting a connect back.

@ttoko, did you urlencoded your base64 code? Its important. 
Can you show me your request?

URL encoding was the issue. I was able to get the connection made.

Thank you!
Verified working. Sharing with the team.

Hi @yarbabin ,

Can you still reproduce this? Using the original payload I do not get a connection made anymore.

Hello @yarbabin,

Our team has remediated this vulnerability. Please check your original Proof of Concept, and let us know if you think the bug is still exploitable. If you find a way to bypass our fix, please open a new and give us further details. Thanks for your efforts in keeping Informatica safe, and well done!

Regards,
The Informatica Team

Congratulations! Your bug is eligible for swag. Please make sure your address and shirt size are correct in Hacker One.

Thank you!
